intro: Rosa villosa var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed rose, is a variation of the Rosa villosa species native to North America. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and foliage, distinguishing it from the more commonly hairy forms of its species. The plant produces fragrant, semi-double pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
